types_of_topspin_contact.probleme: Players lack control/variation in topspin contact and cannot match ball/spin to situation.
types_of_topspin_contact.diagnostic: Contact type (grazing vs deeper sponge/wood) determines spin-speed tradeoff and arc.
causes_communes: Single-speed looping regardless of spin or ball quality
Poor listening/feel for quality of contact

debutant: Train ‘barely grazing’ contact for slow, spinny openings vs heavy backspin; focus on sound/feel replication.
Practice ‘glancing blow’ for counters/blocks with slight upward stroke.
intermediaire: Use ‘medium into sponge’ to sustain attacks; alternate with ‘deep into sponge’ to pressure.
Shadow and multiball to vary upward vs forward components by spin (more up vs backspin).
avance: Reserve ‘sponge and wood’ kill loops for read/position-perfect balls; avoid on neutral/uncertain balls.
Deliberately mix depth/arc to disrupt timing.

exercices_complementaires.description: Five-ball sequences progressing from barely_grazing → medium → deep → sponge_and_wood → glancing_blow, naming contact aloud to ingrain distinctions.

metriques_progression: Opening-loop consistency vs heavy backspin at three contact types
Kill-loop success % on designated weak balls
erreurs_a_eviter: Using kill-loop contact on difficult balls
Looping short balls too high/deep by over-lifting

meta.article_title: January 29, 2024 – Start With Your Trickiest Serve

start_with_trickiest_serve.probleme: Players save best/deep spin serves for late points and miss strategic benefits.
start_with_trickiest_serve.diagnostic: Early deployment reveals effectiveness, conditions receiver, and expands threat set.
causes_communes: Overreliance on only short serves early

debutant: Open first service game with your trickiest/deep spin serve once to test reaction.
intermediaire: Cycle back to it sparingly so it remains a credible threat that slows receiver’s reactions to other serves.
avance: Against regular sparring partners, randomize start to avoid anticipation.

metriques_progression: First-rotation serve effectiveness (errors/weak returns forced)
Subsequent short-serve success after establishing deep threat
erreurs_a_eviter: Waiting until deuce to try an untested serve
Overusing a deep tricky serve so opponent adapts quickly

court_tricks.diagnostic: Small skills (ball pick-up with foot, backspin returns to other courts, quick net check, stylish ball-hiding, professional dress) streamline play and project poise.

debutant: Learn foot pick-up and gentle backspin returns to distant courts.
intermediaire: Use racket length to check net height; practice backspin ‘float’ returns.
avance: Develop smooth pre-point routines (e.g., backspin ball-hide flourish) and dress professionally to prime mindset.

erreurs_a_eviter: Smacking stray balls back wildly
Ignoring net height at match start

meta.article_title: January 15, 2024 - Make a Habit of Finding the SS – the Opponent’s Weak Shots and Spots

find_weak_shots_and_spots.probleme: Players fail to systematically identify opponent-specific weaknesses.
find_weak_shots_and_spots.diagnostic: Success requires the habit of searching for and exploiting individualized weaknesses, even with one-off tactics.
causes_communes: Belief that opponent-specific tactics don’t generalize

debutant: Probe early with varied serves/placements to locate weak zones (e.g., simple low no-spin, fast wide serves).
intermediaire: Once a weakness is found, press it repeatedly until opponent adjusts; then branch to complementary placement.
avance: Build a mental library of SS patterns (e.g., attack middle then extreme wide; quick wide push BH; big breaking serve to BH).

metriques_progression: Time-to-detect weakness (points elapsed)
Conversion rate when targeting identified SS
erreurs_a_eviter: Overvaluing variation when a single exploit keeps working
Abandoning a discovered edge too soon

move_the_extra_inch.probleme: Shots break down due to near-positioning and leaning.
move_the_extra_inch.diagnostic: Precision game requires last-second micro-adjustment steps or shuffles.
causes_communes: Stopping after a large move; not expecting micro-move

debutant: Drill small adjustment steps after each approach; never hit while leaning.
intermediaire: Incorporate micro-shuffles into FH/BH patterns; cue ‘expect the extra inch’.
avance: Tempo drills focusing on late micro-steps under time pressure.

metriques_progression: Leaned-contact % reduced
Rally consistency when forced to adjust late
erreurs_a_eviter: Reaching instead of stepping
Locking feet and rotating awkwardly

meta.article_title: December 18, 2023 - Are You Too Backhand Oriented?

too_backhand_oriented.probleme: Over-reliance on backhand at expense of forehand development.
too_backhand_oriented.diagnostic: Foot placement (playing foot forward) biases toward BH and makes FH awkward; limits power/endings.
causes_communes: Avoidance of temporary losses during FH development

debutant: Adopt neutral stance (feet parallel) for BH; slightly back playing foot for FH.
Commit practice volume to FH even if short-term results dip.
intermediaire: Design serve/receive patterns that bring FH into play from both wings.
avance: Train parallel-feet FH for faster at-table play if flexibility permits.

metriques_progression: Share of points ended by FH increases
Stance neutrality consistency on video review
erreurs_a_eviter: Twisting to create FH from BH-biased stance
Abandoning stance change after early discomfort

meta.article_title: December 11, 2023 - Why Aren't You Pushing Heavy?

why_arent_you_pushing_heavy.probleme: Safe pushes lack bite; opponents open easily.
why_arent_you_pushing_heavy.diagnostic: Insufficient wrist snap/graze yields only ‘good’ backspin instead of ‘maximal’.

debutant: Practice vigorous wrist rotation and fine grazing to maximize backspin on service returns.
intermediaire: Target deep/low heavy pushes; mix occasional fake-heavy light-spin as deception.
avance: Use heavy push selectively to force net errors or weak lifts; avoid vs opponents who thrive on lifting extreme spin.

metriques_progression: Opponent net-error rate vs your long push
Ball bite (measured by bounce skid/return difficulty)
erreurs_a_eviter: Patting returns safely without purpose
Telegraphing heavy vs light without deception

fake_outs.probleme: Predictable play lets opponents read direction/spin.
fake_outs.diagnostic: Last-second directional/spin changes create free points.

debutant: Practice BH blocks/pushes aiming crosscourt then switching down-the-line at last moment.
intermediaire: Use shoulder rotation feints on FH; look-away fakes sparingly; fake-spin serves/pushes (big motion, little spin).
avance: Serve-step feint: begin stepping around BH then reverse to wide FH to bait return.

metriques_progression: Forced misread % on deception drills
Points won outright via fake-outs per match
erreurs_a_eviter: Overdoing theatrics that ruin timing
Telegraphing the switch too early

meta.article_title: November 27, 2023 - Forcing or Adjusting Your Game

forcing_or_adjusting.probleme: Players default to one tactical mode (force or adjust) instead of blending both.
forcing_or_adjusting.diagnostic: Winning requires imposing strengths while tailoring to opponent’s weaknesses.
causes_communes: Insufficient scouting of opponent’s weak side/middle/angle coverage

debutant: Create a base plan that forces your strength (e.g., short serve to draw push → opening loop).
intermediaire: Overlay adjustments: target weaker wing, heavy-push if they struggle to lift, deep spin serves vs poor long-serve handlers.
avance: Dynamic sequencing: force your rally pattern then pivot to opponent-specific exploit (e.g., tall player’s middle, short player’s corners).

metriques_progression: Number of purposeful tactical shifts per game
Point win rate after planned force+adjust sequences
erreurs_a_eviter: Insisting on your A-plan when it’s clearly being neutralized
Over-adjusting and abandoning strengths

meta.article_title: November 20, 2023 - Are You Maximizing Your Angles?

maximizing_angles.probleme: Attacks limited to standard crosscourt corners; opponents cover easily.
maximizing_angles.diagnostic: With topspin/short balls/wide positions you can go outside the corner for extra angle.
causes_communes: Instinctive aiming to inside of corner
No practice pushing edge of angle envelope

debutant: Drill wide-angle targets beyond corners; accept early misses to calibrate.
intermediaire: After going wide, sometimes go wide again to same spot to punish over-recovery.
avance: Take short serves off the bounce to create immediate outside-corner angles.

metriques_progression: Successful outside-corner attempts per set
Forced opponent lunges/errors from wide plays
erreurs_a_eviter: Always switching opposite after one wide ball (becoming predictable)
Lunging rather than moving to cover outside-corner replies

meta.article_title: November 13, 2023 - Coaching Between Games for the Non-Coach

coaching_between_games_noncoach.probleme: Helpers don’t know what to say during breaks/timeouts.
coaching_between_games_noncoach.diagnostic: Calm, simple, specific guidance plus confidence-building and targeted questions is most effective.
causes_communes: Focusing on winning/losing rather than plan

debutant: Speak slowly; give 2–3 specific items (best serve/receive/placement).
intermediaire: Boost confidence with practice-match framing and brief focus resets (10-second stare).
avance: When unsure, ask guiding questions (go-to serve, receive vs common serve, weakest opponent area) to trigger tactical thinking.

metriques_progression: Clarity of between-game plan stated by player
Reduced visible nervousness after interventions
erreurs_a_eviter: Vague advice (‘play better receives’)
Sounding anxious; saying ‘relax’ without tools
